tool.name: SAGA.ta_slope_stability.0
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayA False isArrayBmin False isArrayBmax False isArrayCmin False isArrayCmax False isArrayDmin False isArrayDmax False isArrayEmin False isArrayEmax False isArrayFmin False isArrayFmax False output_data_G $output_data_G output_data_H $output_data_H name SAGA.ta_slope_stability.0 A $A Bmin $Bmin Bmax $Bmax Cmin $Cmin Cmax $Cmax Dmin $Dmin Dmax $Dmax Emin $Emin Emax $Emax Fmin $Fmin Fmax $Fmax fBmin $fBmin fBmax $fBmax fCmin $fCmin fCmax $fCmax fDmin $fDmin fDmax $fDmax fEmin $fEmin fEmax $fEmax fFmin $fFmin fFmax $fFmax fI $fI prefer $prefer response $response outputType_G $OutputSection_G.outputType_G transmissionMode_G $OutputSection_G.transmissionMode_G outputType_H $OutputSection_H.outputType_H transmissionMode_H $OutputSection_H.transmissionMode_H

param.name: A
param.label: Slope grid (rad)
param.help: Slope grid (rad) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Bmin
param.label: Min thickness grid (m)
param.help: A grid representing minimum cell layer thicknesses to potential shear plane (in meters) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Bmax
param.label: Max thickness grid (m)
param.help: A grid representing maximum cell layer thicknesses to potential shear plane (in meters) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Cmin
param.label: Min saturation grid (-)
param.help: A grid representing minimum cell relative water saturation of layer (dimensionless) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Cmax
param.label: Max saturation grid (-)
param.help: A grid representing maximum cell relative water saturation of layer (dimensionless) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Dmin
param.label: Min friction grid (degree)
param.help: A grid representing minimum cell frictional shear strength of layer (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Dmax
param.label: Max friction grid (degree)
param.help: A grid representing maximum cell frictional shear strength of layer (in degrees) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Emin
param.label: Min density grid (g/cm3)
param.help: A grid representing minimum cell bulk density of layer (in grams per cubiccentimeters) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Emax
param.label: Max density grid (g/cm3)
param.help: A grid representing maximum cell bulk density of layer (in grams per cubiccentimeters) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Fmin
param.label: Min cohesion grid (MPa)
param.help: A grid representing minimum cell layer cohesion (in Megapascals) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: Fmax
param.label: Max cohesion grid (MPa)
param.help: A grid representing maximum cell layer cohesion (in Megapascals) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: fBmin
param.label: Min global thickness (m)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fBmax
param.label: Max global thickness (m)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fCmin
param.label: Min global saturation (-)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fCmax
param.label: Max global saturation (-)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fDmin
param.label: Min global friction (degree)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fDmax
param.label: Max global friction (degree)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fEmin
param.label: Min global density (g/cm3)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fEmax
param.label: Max global density (g/cm3)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fFmin
param.label: Min global cohesion (MPa)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fFmax
param.label: Max global cohesion (MPa)
param.help: Constant value if no raster set

param.name: fI
param.label: Parameter sampling runs
param.help: Number of sampling cycles

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_G
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_G
param.label: FS values
param.help: Resulting factor-of-safety (-) grid

section.name: OutputSection_H
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_H
param.label: FS classes
param.help: Resulting stability (0/1) grid

tool.help: This tool computes a slope stability (expressed as a factor-of-safety) raster according to the traditional infinite slope model theory (see cf Selby, 1993) The resulting raster represents the ratio of resisting forces/driving forces (fs) on a potential shear plane with fs lesser 1 unstable, fs greater 1 stable. Except for a slope raster (in radians), all input variables can be specified either globally or distributed (through grids). The tool creates a continuous fs raster (values above 10 are truncated), and a binary stability grid with nodata = stable, 1 = unstable (optional).
